javadoc:
PartitionCodeSubModel (Model-P) defines subroutines which do not share code with other subroutines and may have one or more entry points. Entry points represent anyone of a variety of flow entries, including a source, called, jump or fall-through entry point.

MODEL-P is the answer to those who always want to be able to know what subroutine a given instruction is in, but also do not want the subroutine to have multiple entry points. When a model-M subroutine has multiple entry points, that set of code will necessarily consist of several model-P subroutines. When a model-M subroutine has a single entry point, it will consist of a single model-P subroutine which has the same address set and entry point. @see ghidra.program.model.block.CodeBlockModel Created February 7, 2002.

Construct a Model-P subroutine on a program.
@param program program to create blocks from.

methods.javadoc: @see ghidra.program.model.block.CodeBlockModel#getCodeBlockAt(ghidra.program.model.address.Address, ghidra.util.task.TaskMonitor)
methods.name: getCodeBlockAt
getCodeBlocksContaining
methods.comment:
Get all the Code Blocks containing the address.
 For model-P, there is only one.

params.name: addr
params.comment: Address to find a containing block.

params.name: monitor
params.comment: task monitor which allows user to cancel operation.

throws.comment: if the monitor cancels the operation.

return.comment:
A CodeBlock array with one entry containing the subroutine that
              contains the address null otherwise.

methods.name: getFirstCodeBlockContaining
methods.comment:
Get the (first) Model-P subroutine that contains the address.
 This is equivalent to getCodeBlocksContaining(addr) except that
 it doesn't return an array since model-P subroutines don't share code.

params.name: addr
params.comment: Address to find a containing block.

params.name: monitor
params.comment: task monitor which allows user to cancel operation.

throws.comment: if the monitor cancels the operation.

return.comment:
A CodeBlock if any block contains the address.
         empty array otherwise.

getCodeBlocksContaining
methods.comment: Get an iterator over CodeBlocks which overlap the specified address set.

params.name: addrSet
params.comment: an address set within program

params.name: monitor
params.comment: task monitor which allows user to cancel operation.

methods.name: getName

methods.javadoc:
Return in general how things flow out of this node. This method exists for the SIMPLEBLOCK model.

Since it doesn't make a great deal of sense to ask for this method in the case of subroutines, we return FlowType.UNKNOWN as long as the block exists.

If this block has no valid instructions, it can't flow, so FlowType.INVALID is returned.

@return flow type of this node
methods.name: getFlowType
methods.comment:
Return in general how things flow out of this node.
 This method exists for the SIMPLEBLOCK model.

 
 Since it doesn't make a great deal of sense to ask for this method
 in the case of subroutines, we return FlowType.UNKNOWN
 as long as the block exists.

 
 If this block has no valid instructions, it can't flow,
 so FlowType.INVALID is returned.

methods.name: getSources
methods.comment: Get an iterator over source blocks flowing into this block.

params.name: block
params.comment: code block to get the source iterator for.

params.name: monitor
params.comment: task monitor which allows user to cancel operation.

throws.comment: if the monitor cancels the operation.

methods.name: getNumSources
methods.comment: Get number of block source references flowing into this block.

params.name: block
params.comment: code block to get the source iterator for.

params.name: monitor
params.comment: task monitor which allows user to cancel operation.

throws.comment: if the monitor cancels the operation.

methods.name: getDestinations
methods.comment: Get an iterator over destination blocks flowing from this block.

params.name: block
params.comment: code block to get the destination block iterator for.

params.name: monitor
params.comment: task monitor which allows user to cancel operation.

throws.comment: if the monitor cancels the operation.

methods.name: getNumDestinations
methods.comment:
Get number of destination references flowing out of this subroutine (block).
 All Calls from this block, and all external FlowType block references
 from this block are counted.

params.name: block
params.comment: code block to get the number of destination references from.

params.name: monitor
params.comment: task monitor which allows user to cancel operation.

throws.comment: if the monitor cancels the operation.

methods.name: createSub
methods.comment: Create a new Subroutine which has an address set and entry point.

params.name: set
params.comment: the address set contained within the subroutine/block.

params.name: entryPt
params.comment: the entry point address.

methods.name: createBlockGraph
methods.comment:
Generate a graph of a Model-M subroutine.  This graph will facilitate the
 Model-P algorythm as performed in the partitionGraph() method.

params.name: modelMSub
params.comment: a valid Model-M subroutine block.

params.name: monitor
params.comment: task monitor which allows user to cancel operation.

throws.comment: if the monitor cancels the operation.

methods.name: partitionGraph
methods.comment:
Partition the Model-M subroutine graph using the Model-P algorythm.
 The method createBlockGraph() must first be called to generate the
 initial Model-M graph.

params.name: monitor
params.comment: task monitor which allows user to cancel operation.

throws.comment: if the monitor cancels the operation.

methods.name: fromGraphToSubs
methods.comment:
Extract Model-P subroutines from Model-M subroutine graph following
 call to partitionGraph().

params.name: monitor
params.comment: task monitor which allows user to cancel operation.

throws.comment: if the monitor cancels the operation.

methods.name: getModelPSubs
methods.comment: Generate a list of Model-P subroutines contained within a single Model-M subroutine.

params.name: modelMSub
params.comment: a valid Model-M subroutine block.

throws.comment: if the monitor cancels the operation.

name: PartitionCodeSubModel
comment:
PartitionCodeSubModel (Model-P) defines subroutines which do not share code with
 other subroutines and may have one or more entry points.
 Entry points represent anyone of a variety of flow entries, including a source, called, jump or
 fall-through entry point.
 
 MODEL-P is the answer to those who always want to be able to know what subroutine
 a given instruction is in, but also do not want the subroutine to have multiple
 entry points.  When a model-M subroutine has multiple entry points,
 that set of code will necessarily consist of several model-P subroutines.  When
 a model-M subroutine has a single entry point, it will consist of a single model-P subroutine
 which has the same address set and entry point.
